intro: Stenomesson eustephioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has linear, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous fruits and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
